intro: Tragus heptaneuron, commonly known as the seven-node tragus, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while the flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Tragus heptaneuron is often used in traditional medicine for its potential healing properties.
